attributes.action: Stop the land asset stripping of the NHS recommended in the Naylor report.
attributes.background: Forcing NHS trusts to sell off their valuable land to cover basic costs the government won't adequately is wrong. We don't need a private profit health service system as with the US. It is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Remove GDPR from UK law as soon as we leave the EU in March 2019.
attributes.background: GDPR has probably been the worst piece of red tape to come out of the EU, its extremely costly to businesses, mainly to small businesses who don’t have massive legal departments and staff in place to swallow up the regulation. GDPR is also extremely damaging to our economy.
attributes.additional_details: The UK voted to leave the EU 2 years ago and we are still having to put up with the ridiculously damaging and annoying regulations. It is believed that the cost of GDPR to UK businesses has already run into the billions, with many small business not at all geared up to deal with it.

attributes.action: Include the welsh flag on the union jack
attributes.background: We must include wales in our community. they are a valuable member of the UK and they seem to be forgotten. i am not a welsh person myself but i think we can all agree they have a fine accent, also the best flag in the world. so why doesn't the UK include it. This HAS to change!
attributes.additional_details: It would be greatly appreciated if the UK government took this into consideration. i think we can all agree this would be a great thing

attributes.action: Allow all shops (regardless of size) to open for only 6 hours on a Sunday.
attributes.background: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for up to any 6 consecutive hours on a Sunday, because Sunday is a special day for families to get together. To protect the high street, the government should also ban home deliveries for online shopping on a Sunday.
attributes.additional_details: The government should allow all shops (regardless of size) to open only for any 6 hours on Sundays and the government should force all shops (regardless of size) to close on Easter Sunday and on Christmas Day when it falls on a Sunday. The only exceptions should be petrol stations that only sell fuel, airport shops (past security), pharmacies and shops on seagoing ships.

attributes.action: Legalise plural marriage.
attributes.background: The people will be free to decide for themselves how many people they can marry.
attributes.additional_details: The government has no reason to involve itself in the love life of its citizens.

attributes.action: Immediate cap on fees charged by letting agents
attributes.background: The rental market is open to abuse by letting agents who can name their price; there is no correlation between the costs they incur and the fees charged. It's a free for all, with fees for the same processes widely differing for no apparent reason but to put more money in the pocket of the agent.
attributes.additional_details:
Do these examples seem fair?

Print & sign tenancy contract: £120
What does it really cost to print a document?

Credit check: £100
Credit checks typically cost less than £30

Moving in fee covering background & credit check: £395
That's £395 BEFORE you've even paid your rent & deposit. And if you 'fail' you lose your money.

We're not proposing scrapping the fees, after all the agents do incur costs. But a cap would give clarity for all, and prevent profiteering hitting renters in the pocket.

attributes.action: Lower the retirement age for frontline road and call takers ambulance staff
attributes.background: 65 is the retirement age for ambulance staff. This type of work is too much at this age. Carrying patients, 12 hour shifts, night shifts and the type of jobs we see. We have a high mortality rate. We need to be brought in line with fire staff and police staff.
attributes.additional_details: There is evidence that ambulance staff have a mortality rate of 2 years post retirement. At a time when our staff should be relaxing after caring so much for so many years many are being taken from us too early. Reduce the retirement age

attributes.action: Include awareness of emotional and physical abuse to the national curriculum
attributes.background: We're at a time in our lives and our society where abuse, emotional or physical, is being seen as normal. Children as young as even 10 or some younger are not able to recognise normal behaviour anymore and see abuse of any kind as normal. This needs to stop now, any age it's not acceptable.

attributes.action: Provide armed security for the Orthodox Jewish Community in the UK
attributes.background: European governments are providing armed security for synagogues and Jewish institutions following numerous fatal terror attacks. This is because where there is a serious risk of fatalities, the only feasible solution is to provide armed security for Jewish public places. The UK must do the same.
attributes.additional_details:
The Terror threat level in Europe is getting worse, with innocent people of all races being murdered. The threat to the Jewish community is always greater, in particular when elements of the media promote anti-semitic perspectives on the Middle East conflict. The Gov't Provides armed Police for Foreign embassies and must do the same for it's own citizens who need it.

It is impossible for a policeman or security guard without a weapon to protect sites from  terrorists armed with weapons.

attributes.action: Replace the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation
attributes.background: I believe that the ombudsman service just has not got the ability to handle complaints about financial services. There is evidence in the media and on online review services like trustpilot.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to consider replacing the financial ombudsman service with a publicly funded organisation that is not funded by, or affiliated with, the banks and other financial services.

attributes.action: Change The Colour Of Rear Vehicle Registration Plates To White
attributes.background: In many countries around the world registration plates on vehicles tend to be white at the front and white at the back. In the UK our rear plate is yellow, which spoils the appearance of our vehicles. White number plates would go with any body paintwork colour and this should be adopted.
attributes.additional_details: With our vehicles currently having a white registration plate at the front it would make sense to match this with a white registration plate at the back.

attributes.action: Create a national safeguarding database.
attributes.background: Too many safeguarding cases go under the radar and have unknown outcomes.  As the way things stand now; disclosures are made and followed up. If the parents are ‘caught’ they sometimes leave the setting/more to a new one or if more serious issue/move out of the area or can be lying and deceptive.
attributes.additional_details: To prevent this from happening there would be a national safeguarding and child protection database. This would have any safeguarding, child protection cases uploaded so that every local authority and council could see the case files and would be flagged up as soon as the family move in to the area. All professionals involved in the case would have access to the database to upload their case notes.

attributes.action: The Government Must Cut Waiting Times For Children’s Mental Health Services
attributes.background: We call on the government to tackle the mental health epidemic at the root, and fast - to do this it needs to cut waiting times for children (5-16 years old), shortening its timeline to introduce maximum waiting times by 2022-23. If not, our country will lose countless young lives in the meantime.
attributes.additional_details: On May 9 two committees of MPs published a report saying the government's plans will take too long to come into effect and will ‘fail a generation’. On average, a child waits a decade from the moment they suffer their first symptom of poor mental health to receiving treatment. At such a crucial stage in children's development, mental health issues should be treated as a matter of urgency. Diagnosing and treating issues early will help deal with problems before they develop into something worse.

attributes.action: Provide testing strips to all type 2 diabetics
attributes.background: Type 2 diabetics need to check blood sugar regardless of what medication they take or if diet controlled.

attributes.action: Remove swimming from the English national curriculum for school students.
attributes.background: Students across the country are being forced to do swimming even though they may be uncomfortable with swimming or struggle to do it. With the help of this petition, children will not be forced to something, which weekly, children are worrying about.

attributes.action: Safeguard public funds with full annual NAO risk audit on all outsourcers
attributes.background: The Government should change the law so that the NAO is given responsibly for auditing any company that wins Government contract worth more than £20 million and that any appropriate contract must include an agreement to be audited by the NAO and the results made public.
attributes.additional_details: As illustrated by Carillion and numerous other major corporate failures before it, the ‘Big Four’ independent audit opinion has been confirmed as inherently flawed.  There is an inherent risk in the ‘Big Four’ conducting annual audits of companies where senior management are ex-‘Big Four’ themselves.  A mutual understanding serves each party in this situation as well as the knowledge that any moral hazard contracts or companies are ultimately backed by the government and UK taxpayers.

attributes.action: Give disabled victims of crime funding for support & services to obtain justice!
attributes.background: Disabled people such as those suffering with Autism find dealing with stress and anxiety very difficult, especially when they are victims of crime, it has a huge negative impact on their health, their life both at work and at home as well as their mental well being.
attributes.additional_details: Adequate funding and support should always be available via a bespoke fund for those disabled victims such as autistics or those with mental disabilities ensuring their needs are met to provide the services and support required so the most vulnerable in our society, who struggle to cope with life in general, let alone when they are the victims of crime are not left alone to deal with courts, ombudsman, regulators, MP's, media and police plus all the paperwork and documentation it entails.

attributes.action: Debate diesel prices and car tax
attributes.background: Diesel prices: we were encouraged to buy a diesel car and now diesel prices and car tax are going up (and the roads are full of potholes). Electric cars are no good for towing and you have to sit about in services for a hour to recharge them.

attributes.action: Abolish prohibited lanes for HGV overtaking on M11 and A14.
attributes.background: These stretches of the M11 and A14 where overtaking for HGV’s is prohibited are completely counter productive. They serve to prevent HGV’s overtaking for long periods and inconveniencing other road users.
attributes.additional_details: In reality these lanes create long tailbacks as faster/unladen HGV’s have to queue behind other slower/laden vehicles uphill with reduced speeds of sometimes 25-30mph. When the restriction ends all the faster HGV’s accerlerate pull out into lane 2 to overtake. These lanes are a complete false economy and are dangerous.

attributes.action: Investigate the role of the Information Commission due to its ineffectiveness
attributes.background: Call for an investigation into the role of the ICO and why they refer the public back to, and do not act against, the public bodies/organisations who do not reply to data requests and maintain their silence in order to block/obstruct complaints. Urgent changes/reforms to the law need to be made
attributes.additional_details: Due to the advice by the petitions committee when rejecting 3 petitions - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/206379 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/205268 - https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/213769 we call on the government/Secretary of State to make appropriate provision to ensure that the Information Commission act to assist members of the public to obtain full disclosure of their records in order to pursue complaints further & ban public bodies from withholding records

attributes.action: Add 1p Income Tax & Reduce Aid to OECD average to create a BREXIT readiness fund
attributes.background: I believe the majority of British People support Foreign Aid spending but feel we are spending a bit too much currently. I also believe our Country is in need of Strategic Infrastructure and Business Support Spending to help us during the pre Brexit and immediate post Brexit period.

attributes.action: Raise the legal age to 25 for buying knives or blades of any type.
attributes.background: Children as young as 14 are carrying & using knives to harm others.The current age of 18 yrs is clearly not enough. Not everyone will adhere to a knife amnesty, nor will stop and search reach all.Raise the legal age to 25.Make it harder for them to obtain in the first place so less knives on streets

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow boys to wear shorts.
attributes.background: Most schools no longer give boys the option to wear shorts except when taking part in physical education however all schools allow girls to wear skirts. This is sexist and should be resolved by requiring schools to allow boys to wear shorts.

attributes.action: Cap the price of private and university owned student accommodation
attributes.background: Students are becoming more ripped off by the price of student accommodation each year thus becoming harder to live. It is already unfair that Student Finance dictate our maintenance loan based on our household income and the majority have to live in a student overdraft. We want fair reduced prices.

attributes.action: large vehicle awareness a mandatory part of obtaining a small vehicle licence
attributes.background: I feel that not enough people driving small vehicles are educated about the dangers of sharing the road with Heavy goods vehicles, Dangerous goods and long loads pose a threat to life if the proper information hasn't been given to all including those who are simply sharing the road.
attributes.additional_details: All I am asking is for people to be taught about what the signs mean on trucks that are designed to warn other road users of the dangers the vehicle poses. And for potential car licence holders to be educated on stopping times and blind spots of different vehicles. 75% of accidents between HGVs and cars are the car drivers fault and being given more awareness as part of a small vehicle licence could drastically improve those figures and even save lives!

attributes.action: Introduce Religious Studies/ REPS as an EBacc humanity subject
attributes.background: So many of us at our school have been restricted due to being forced to do EBacc. We only get given 4 choices, 2 of which have to be a language or a humanity, either history or geography. Many students want to do RS but cannot due to limited options.
attributes.additional_details: Religious, Ethical and Philosophical Studies (REPS) is an academically challenging subject that it much more interesting and useful for many school students than History or Geography. It encourages debate and gives us the freedom to express our views. It also improves essay writing skills important to other GCSEs such as English, further developing us there, and gives us the knowledge and ability to discuss current affairs and issues, in addition to past issues like history.

attributes.action: The abolition of Audit total exemption for small private limited companies.
attributes.background: This provision is being severely abused by many claiming that their retained annual profit is around £200 - £2,000, totally unrealistic, and is costing the Treasury and the NHS billions of pounds in loss revenue and, above all, nothing is done about it.

attributes.action: Give free child care to all 2 year olds
attributes.background: Why should only parents on certain benefits receive childcare? For fairness, all 2 year olds should receive free childcare, regardless of background.

attributes.action: Increase the expenditure of money on prisons.
attributes.background: The prison system hasn't been correctly funded or managed for years. We propose that the government spends more of its expenditure on the prison system to increase capacity and pursue its purpose.

attributes.action: Get Michael Gove to maintain farming subsidies after Brexit.
attributes.background: Under current EU legislation farmers in the UK receive 3 billion pounds year in subsidies mostly in basic payments which are based on per acre owned of land.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove the environment secretary has pledged post Brexit to maintain the basic payments for most farmers for a transition period only. He is in the meantime reviewing several options to cap the payments and introduce progressive reductions.

The petition is to maintain the payments to the farmers.

British Farming employs 3.8 million people and is a business worth 109 billion. The idea of the petition is to educate the public about the value British farming has on the country and ask for their support by signing a petition to lobby their MP’s to support continuing subsidies for British farmers.

attributes.action: Allow IVF medication to be donated or sold through appropriate channels.
attributes.background: IVF medication is extremely expensive and is very often left over in large quantities due to miscalculation or like in my case because the treatment didn’t work. I have £800 worth of perfectly good medication (non-refrigerated) and my only option is, incredibly, to DISPOSE OF IT.
attributes.additional_details:
I contacted charities and IVF support groups and found that it’s actually illegal under the Medicines Act and the Drug trafficking Act to give them to someone else. 

IVF clinics or infertility charities should be allowed to redistribute the medication, helping families that cannot afford the drugs.

attributes.action: Urge the international community to bring Bashar al Assad to justice.
attributes.background:
Since the start of the Syrian Civil War in 2011, hundreds of thousands of civilians have been murdered in Syria, with the vast majority of deaths being attributed to Assad and his forces.

The international community must do more to bring Assad to justice.
attributes.additional_details:
Assad has invalidated his sovereignty over Syria. Hundreds of thousands of his own people have been murdered and tortured. Intervention is justified and necessary both morally and politically on the basis of these grave human rights violations. 

http://sn4hr.org

http://www.syriahr.com/en/

attributes.action: Ban large boats from passing through swing bridges at peak times.
attributes.background:
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic
3. Pollution - Every car passing the route will be sat in the same spot with the engine running for a good 20-30 minutes
attributes.additional_details:
Reasons why boats shouldn't be allowed to pass through swing bridges at peak times;
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic. Dying? Tough - a boat needs to deliver a few boxes of car parts
3. Pollution - pretty much every car that is on its way home from work will be sat in the same spot with the engine running (unless it's stop start) for a good 20-30 minutes

attributes.action: Ban robotic trading of stocks, shares or financial derivatives
attributes.background: Robotic/algorithmic trading  of stocks, shares and financial derivatives are used by big corporates to steal money from retail investors.
attributes.additional_details: Big banks and institutions should not be allowed do use automatic trading which could cause flash crash in the markets eventually stealing money from weak hands of retail investors. Such trading should be banned. Markets would be less volatile and retail investors feel more secured to invest in such a situation.

attributes.action: I believe that every adult in the UK should pay £10 a month to the NHS.
attributes.background: I have been admitted into hospital twice in 5 years for 2 major life changing operations. I noticed how loving and caring the porters, nurses, doctors and surgeons all were. I was very shocked to see that they work 12+ hours a day, clean, cook, pay for parking and bring their own food.
attributes.additional_details: I would rather spend my £13.12 (which I have to pay every month for my BBC TV LICENCE) on the NHS. It should be compulsory!

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to ride motorcycles with a higher engine size than 50cc.
attributes.background: 16 years old are in danger of being taken off their bikes due to them being restricted and other volumes of traffic going at a much higher rate of speed past them, therefore increasing the accidents including young riders. 125cc would possibly be a better replacement as safer in the long term.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment the law states that 16 year olds cannot ride any motorcycle with an engine size higher than 50cc, this can be very dangerous as many roads now have speed limits way higher than this not allowing you to keep up with traffic or get out of a situation very quickly, therefore increasing the accidents including motorcycles and young riders. 125cc is a more sensible speed which is more reliable for young riders out on the roads at 16. To make sure it is safe for a young driver an additional test could be added allowing you to progress up rather than just a CBT, this time including a small theory

attributes.action: Educate people on buying bikes, bike safety and bike security.
attributes.background: So many people go off to buy cheap bikes and they have faults very quickly.So they throw it away or repair and replace parts often, this can a have a negative impact on the environment and people will ride bikes less, increasing the negative impact on the environment.We should ride bikes a lot more.

attributes.action: Ratify Kampala amendments, give ICC jurisdiction over UK for crime of aggression
attributes.background:
The International Criminal Court, through the Kampala amendments (2010), is gaining jurisdiction over the crime of aggression on 17 July 2018, for those states that have ratified the amendments.

The UK, having pushed for this for decades, must ratify.

attributes.action: Remove  the Commercial speed restrictions on vehicles such as duel use pickups,
attributes.background: Vehicles such as Dual Cab pickups are still subjected to commercial speed restrictions on certain roads due to their curb weight even thou they are someone’s personal vehicle and not used for commercial use, remove these restrictions for personal use vehicles,
attributes.additional_details: If your pickup exceeds a unladen weight of 2048 kilos it has speed restrictions on certain roads which is rubbish as most modern cars such as range rovers weight sometimes over 3 tonne, just because a vehicle is deemed commercial doesn’t mean it should be restricted, personal use commercial vehicles not being used for business shouldn’t be subjected to this law, as new pick ups have better safety equipment than when this law was written,

attributes.action: Change GCSE's Grades From 9-1 to 1-9
attributes.background: Most people get confused with the new GCSE's grading system and personally i do not like it.

attributes.action: Public transport(bus) to have cabin filters to protect passengers and drivers
attributes.background: high pollution is danger for all of us, the cabin filter will protect and save lives
attributes.additional_details: it was a few documentary on tv shown that danger (heavy) car emission are cumulated in public transport like tram and buses. The ventilate is not an option, a proper pollen filter will make a different and it will save some lives, and help

attributes.action: Ban Govt ministers of places where homosexuality is illegal owning UK companies
attributes.background: In many countries, homosexuality is still considered a crime. This is in direct contrast to the UK, where same-sex sexual activity has been legal since 1967. Government Ministers in countries where homosexuality is still illegal should be banned from owning UK based companies.
attributes.additional_details: Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan is currently the Deputy Prime Minister of the United Arab Emirates, where same-sex sexual activity is illegal. He also owns City Football Group, which Manchester City FC is part of. Football is the national sport of the UK, yet the owner of the Premier League champions is Deputy Prime Minister of a country where homosexuality is illegal. If LGBT equality is to be achieved, Government Ministers from these countries cannot be permitted to own UK-based companies.

attributes.action: Recall of MPs Act to include failure of MPs to abide by Constituents’ wishes
attributes.background: The Recall of MPs Act 2015 is very limited in scope. It only covers when an MPs is sentenced to a prison term or is suspended from the House for at least 21 sitting days.  It should be extended to allow for the recall of MPs that ignore the wishes of the majority of their constituents.
attributes.additional_details: A third reason for the Recall of an MP should include acting contrary to their Election Manifesto, by for example voting against something they promised, and acting contrary to the wishes of the majority of their constituents as expressed in a national or local referendum.

attributes.action: Reform the police complaints system
attributes.background: For over 50 years, the system has failed to protect Black/Asian people from feeling targeted and racially profiled by the police. We need a new body to investigate police misuse of powers, recommend that individual officers be prosecuted or sacked and recommend ways to reform the police.
attributes.additional_details:
This new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints itself, including being able to call witnesses and summon documents and records. Most importantly, it must include representatives of victims of police misconduct to ensure it has the confidence of every individual in society. People should be protected regardless of colour or background.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/207561
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/166709

attributes.action: New high speed rail link parkway station for Maidstone
attributes.background: The HS1 link bypasses Maidstone and the town is at a disadvantage to other Kent towns in investment and travel provision. A new parkway station could be accessed from the A229 and would serve both Maidstone and the surrounding towns. There should have been a station when it was first developed.
attributes.additional_details: The HS1 high speed rail line runs north of Maidstone, providing faster travel links to Ebbslfeet and Ashford as well as towns further away such as Canterbury and Margate, but the County Town receives no benefit. Investment in Ashford and Ebbsfleet is significantly greater than Maidstone and the town still suffers from a poor and very slow train service to London compared to other towns outside of London. It takes twice as long to reach London from Maidstone than from Ashford which is ridiculous.

attributes.action: Renationalise all rail as they do not care for the consumer at all.
attributes.background: The new timetable that has been released has been a complete mess as their have been hunders of cancellations in peak times. They have removed services to blatantly avoid paying delay repay. Its abhorrent they get away with this and its about time the rail companies became publically owned.
attributes.additional_details: Check any timetable and you'll see the amount of services cancelled daily.

attributes.action: Ban Smoking on streets
attributes.background: Smoking on the streets is bad for other people through passive smoking and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: It was proven that when the indoor smoking ban was brought into force over 700,000 people stopped smoking

attributes.action: Ban Abortion in 2018
attributes.background: Abortion should be illegal in all circumstances. The Abortion Act of 1967 left loopholes that allow too many abortions. There are alternatives to abortion: keep the baby, adoption or fostering, and medical research to prevent abortion being the only option when women are at risk during pregnancy.
attributes.additional_details: Many women have more than one abortion. This costs taxpayers' money, some of which goes to private providers, and increases pressure on our NHS, which is already under huge strain. 2012 figures suggest that the NHS may spend over £800,000 a week on “repeat” abortions. That is the hidden cost of abortion. The Government must invest more in educating people to avoid unwanted pregnancies and provide better support for young mothers and single mothers. Everyone has the right to life.

attributes.action: Ban outdoors barbecuing of meat & fish.
attributes.background: Just as the weather has warmed up so has the preponderance for barbecuing outdoors. Being able to enjoy time in the garden is spoiled by the disgusting smell of burning flesh and barbecue smoke.
attributes.additional_details: The char is laden with cancer-causing compounds called heterocyclic amines that form when meat and high heat are combined to create a blackened crust. Barbecue smoke contains polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons toxic chemicals that can damage your lungs.

attributes.action: Remove the household means assessment from student loans for all adult students.
attributes.background:
Parental maintenance cease at 18. The UK government assesses an entitlement to a student loan for an adult upon the income of people who live in their household but may have had no previous financial responsibility for ? 
Allow all students to apply for the maximum award. It’s all repayable
attributes.additional_details: The student loan assessment is unfair. A common example is where a students mother lives with a new partner. The partner earns a good salary and pays maintenance for his existing children - however the student applying for university must ask this man, who s/he may only have known for a year for their financial details. Then will be awarded a lesser sum because of this man income . With the expectation that he will top up the reduced loan. This rarely happens leaving the student disadvantaged.
